section.title: practice: file systems
section.para: 1. List the filesystems that are known by your system.
2. Create an ext2 filesystem on the 200MB partition.
section.screen: mke2fs /dev/sdc1 (replace sdc1 with the correct partition)
section.para: 3. Create an ext3 filesystem on the 400MB partition and one of the 300MB logical drives.
section.screen: mke2fs -j /dev/sdb1 (replace sdb1 with the correct partition)
mke2fs -j /dev/sdb5 (replace sdb5 with the correct partition)
section.para: 4. Set the reserved space for root on the logical drive to 0 percent.
5. Verify your work with fdisk and df.
section.screen: mkfs (mke2fs) makes no difference in the output of these commands
The big change is in the next topic: mounting
